channel.title: Repairing a phone antenna?
channel.description: I have a Huawei Piller (M615). It's a cricket phone. I have $0 to buy anything. The other night I got in a fight, and threw my phone down a street. Now, it's broken in multiple places (the plastic shell). It works just as it did before, with an exception. The phone cannot find any cell signal. I don't exactly know why, but I assume it's the antenna. No, it's not some retro phone that has an antenna that you'd pull out the side of it or anything like that. It has one of those integrated ones. So I need to figure out how to attempt a repair on this, mostly because I'm expecting a call from a potential employer sometime this week. Yeah, go figure I break it when I need it most.. Here's what it looks like (ignore the black case): [img]http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/418SqxY2FML._SY300_.jpg[/img]

item.title: Repairing a phone antenna?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Vain_:

if you know anyone stupid enough; anyone can go to walmart and steal the prepaid nokia shits.

That still takes money to activate, I pay for monthly service, and actually just had the bill paid and it expires in November, so I’d rather not pay for another phone line.

Read full topic

item.title: Repairing a phone antenna?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

chillwitm888:

How much are you willing to spend for repair (i mean parts)

It’d depend on what repairs are needed. Like I said, I have no money at this time, but getting this repaired is a priority…
I can’t exactly say what is wrong, as there’s no clear way to tell.
Edit: anything over like $50 would be useless as I could just buy a used one of these for like 20-30 bucks and get it reactivated for about 15.

Read full topic
